00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00044 #define LUSTRE_TRACEFILE_PRIVATE
00045 #include "tracefile.h"

00050 /* XXX move things up to the top, comment */
00051 union cfs_trace_data_union (*cfs_trace_data[TCD_MAX_TYPES])[NR_CPUS] __cacheline_aligned;
00052 
00053 char cfs_tracefile[TRACEFILE_NAME_SIZE];
00054 long long cfs_tracefile_size = CFS_TRACEFILE_SIZE;
00055 static struct tracefiled_ctl trace_tctl;
00056 static DEFINE_MUTEX(cfs_trace_thread_mutex);
00057 static int thread_running = 0;
00058 
00059 static atomic_t cfs_tage_allocated = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00060 
00061 static void put_pages_on_tcd_daemon_list(struct page_collection *pc,
00062                                         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd);
00063 
00064 static inline struct cfs_trace_page *
00065 cfs_tage_from_list(struct list_head *list)
00066 {
00067         return list_entry(list, struct cfs_trace_page, linkage);
00068 }
00069 
00070 static struct cfs_trace_page *cfs_tage_alloc(gfp_t gfp)
00071 {
00072         struct page            *page;
00073         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00074 
00075         /* My caller is trying to free memory */
00076         if (!in_interrupt() && memory_pressure_get())
00077                 return NULL;
00078 
00079         /*
00080          * Don't spam console with allocation failures: they will be reported
00081          * by upper layer anyway.
00082          */
00083         gfp |= __GFP_NOWARN;
00084         page = alloc_page(gfp);
00085         if (page == NULL)
00086                 return NULL;
00087 
00088         tage = kmalloc(sizeof(*tage), gfp);
00089         if (tage == NULL) {
00090                 __free_page(page);
00091                 return NULL;
00092         }
00093 
00094         tage->page = page;
00095         atomic_inc(&cfs_tage_allocated);
00096         return tage;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static void cfs_tage_free(struct cfs_trace_page *tage)
00100 {
00101         __LASSERT(tage != NULL);
00102         __LASSERT(tage->page != NULL);
00103 
00104         __free_page(tage->page);
00105         kfree(tage);
00106         atomic_dec(&cfs_tage_allocated);
00107 }
00108 
00109 static void cfs_tage_to_tail(struct cfs_trace_page *tage,
00110                              struct list_head *queue)
00111 {
00112         __LASSERT(tage != NULL);
00113         __LASSERT(queue != NULL);
00114 
00115         list_move_tail(&tage->linkage, queue);
00116 }
00117 
00118 int cfs_trace_refill_stock(struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd, gfp_t gfp,
00119                            struct list_head *stock)
00120 {
00121         int i;
00122 
00123         /*
00124          * XXX nikita: do NOT call portals_debug_msg() (CDEBUG/ENTRY/EXIT)
00125          * from here: this will lead to infinite recursion.
00126          */
00127 
00128         for (i = 0; i + tcd->tcd_cur_stock_pages < TCD_STOCK_PAGES ; ++ i) {
00129                 struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00130 
00131                 tage = cfs_tage_alloc(gfp);
00132                 if (tage == NULL)
00133                         break;
00134                 list_add_tail(&tage->linkage, stock);
00135         }
00136         return i;
00137 }
00138 
00139 /* return a page that has 'len' bytes left at the end */
00140 static struct cfs_trace_page *
00141 cfs_trace_get_tage_try(struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd, unsigned long len)
00142 {
00143         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00144 
00145         if (tcd->tcd_cur_pages > 0) {
00146                 __LASSERT(!list_empty(&tcd->tcd_pages));
00147                 tage = cfs_tage_from_list(tcd->tcd_pages.prev);
00148                 if (tage->used + len <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)
00149                         return tage;
00150         }
00151 
00152         if (tcd->tcd_cur_pages < tcd->tcd_max_pages) {
00153                 if (tcd->tcd_cur_stock_pages > 0) {
00154                         tage = cfs_tage_from_list(tcd->tcd_stock_pages.prev);
00155                         --tcd->tcd_cur_stock_pages;
00156                         list_del_init(&tage->linkage);
00157                 } else {
00158                         tage = cfs_tage_alloc(GFP_ATOMIC);
00159                         if (unlikely(tage == NULL)) {
00160                                 if ((!memory_pressure_get() ||
00161                                      in_interrupt()) && printk_ratelimit())
00162                                         printk(KERN_WARNING
00163                                                "cannot allocate a tage (%ld)\n",
00164                                                tcd->tcd_cur_pages);
00165                                 return NULL;
00166                         }
00167                 }
00168 
00169                 tage->used = 0;
00170                 tage->cpu = smp_processor_id();
00171                 tage->type = tcd->tcd_type;
00172                 list_add_tail(&tage->linkage, &tcd->tcd_pages);
00173                 tcd->tcd_cur_pages++;
00174 
00175                 if (tcd->tcd_cur_pages > 8 && thread_running) {
00176                         struct tracefiled_ctl *tctl = &trace_tctl;
00177                         /*
00178                          * wake up tracefiled to process some pages.
00179                          */
00180                         wake_up(&tctl->tctl_waitq);
00181                 }
00182                 return tage;
00183         }
00184         return NULL;
00185 }
00186 
00187 static void cfs_tcd_shrink(struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd)
00188 {
00189         int pgcount = tcd->tcd_cur_pages / 10;
00190         struct page_collection pc;
00191         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00192         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00193 
00194         /*
00195          * XXX nikita: do NOT call portals_debug_msg() (CDEBUG/ENTRY/EXIT)
00196          * from here: this will lead to infinite recursion.
00197          */
00198 
00199         if (printk_ratelimit())
00200                 printk(KERN_WARNING "debug daemon buffer overflowed; "
00201                         "discarding 10%% of pages (%d of %ld)\n",
00202                         pgcount + 1, tcd->tcd_cur_pages);
00203 
00204         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pc.pc_pages);
00205 
00206         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &tcd->tcd_pages, linkage) {
00207                 if (pgcount-- == 0)
00208                         break;
00209 
00210                 list_move_tail(&tage->linkage, &pc.pc_pages);
00211                 tcd->tcd_cur_pages--;
00212         }
00213         put_pages_on_tcd_daemon_list(&pc, tcd);
00214 }
00215 
00216 /* return a page that has 'len' bytes left at the end */
00217 static struct cfs_trace_page *cfs_trace_get_tage(struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd,
00218                                                  unsigned long len)
00219 {
00220         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00221 
00222         /*
00223          * XXX nikita: do NOT call portals_debug_msg() (CDEBUG/ENTRY/EXIT)
00224          * from here: this will lead to infinite recursion.
00225          */
00226 
00227         if (len > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00228                 printk(KERN_ERR
00229                        "cowardly refusing to write %lu bytes in a page\n", len);
00230                 return NULL;
00231         }
00232 
00233         tage = cfs_trace_get_tage_try(tcd, len);
00234         if (tage != NULL)
00235                 return tage;
00236         if (thread_running)
00237                 cfs_tcd_shrink(tcd);
00238         if (tcd->tcd_cur_pages > 0) {
00239                 tage = cfs_tage_from_list(tcd->tcd_pages.next);
00240                 tage->used = 0;
00241                 cfs_tage_to_tail(tage, &tcd->tcd_pages);
00242         }
00243         return tage;
00244 }
00245 
00246 int libcfs_debug_msg(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
00247                      const char *format, ...)
00248 {
00249         va_list args;
00250         int     rc;
00251 
00252         va_start(args, format);
00253         rc = libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, format, args, NULL);
00254         va_end(args);
00255 
00256         return rc;
00257 }
00258 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_debug_msg);
00259 
00260 int libcfs_debug_vmsg2(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
00261                        const char *format1, va_list args,
00262                        const char *format2, ...)
00263 {
00264         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd = NULL;
00265         struct ptldebug_header     header = {0};
00266         struct cfs_trace_page     *tage;
00267         /* string_buf is used only if tcd != NULL, and is always set then */
00268         char                      *string_buf = NULL;
00269         char                      *debug_buf;
00270         int                        known_size;
00271         int                        needed = 85; /* average message length */
00272         int                        max_nob;
00273         va_list                    ap;
00274         int                        i;
00275         int                        remain;
00276         int                        mask = msgdata->msg_mask;
00277         char                      *file = (char *)msgdata->msg_file;
00278         struct cfs_debug_limit_state *cdls = msgdata->msg_cdls;
00279 
00280         if (strchr(file, '/'))
00281                 file = strrchr(file, '/') + 1;
00282 
00283         tcd = cfs_trace_get_tcd();
00284 
00285         /* cfs_trace_get_tcd() grabs a lock, which disables preemption and
00286          * pins us to a particular CPU.  This avoids an smp_processor_id()
00287          * warning on Linux when debugging is enabled. */
00288         cfs_set_ptldebug_header(&header, msgdata, CDEBUG_STACK());
00289 
00290         if (tcd == NULL)                /* arch may not log in IRQ context */
00291                 goto console;
00292 
00293         if (tcd->tcd_cur_pages == 0)
00294                 header.ph_flags |= PH_FLAG_FIRST_RECORD;
00295 
00296         if (tcd->tcd_shutting_down) {
00297                 cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00298                 tcd = NULL;
00299                 goto console;
00300         }
00301 
00302         known_size = strlen(file) + 1;
00303         if (msgdata->msg_fn)
00304                 known_size += strlen(msgdata->msg_fn) + 1;
00305 
00306         if (libcfs_debug_binary)
00307                 known_size += sizeof(header);
00308 
00309         /*/
00310          * '2' used because vsnprintf return real size required for output
00311          * _without_ terminating NULL.
00312          * if needed is to small for this format.
00313          */
00314         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00315                 tage = cfs_trace_get_tage(tcd, needed + known_size + 1);
00316                 if (tage == NULL) {
00317                         if (needed + known_size > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)
00318                                 mask |= D_ERROR;
00319 
00320                         cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00321                         tcd = NULL;
00322                         goto console;
00323                 }
00324 
00325                 string_buf = (char *)page_address(tage->page) +
00326                                         tage->used + known_size;
00327 
00328                 max_nob = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - tage->used - known_size;
00329                 if (max_nob <= 0) {
00330                         printk(KERN_EMERG "negative max_nob: %d\n",
00331                                max_nob);
00332                         mask |= D_ERROR;
00333                         cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00334                         tcd = NULL;
00335                         goto console;
00336                 }
00337 
00338                 needed = 0;
00339                 if (format1) {
00340                         va_copy(ap, args);
00341                         needed = vsnprintf(string_buf, max_nob, format1, ap);
00342                         va_end(ap);
00343                 }
00344 
00345                 if (format2) {
00346                         remain = max_nob - needed;
00347                         if (remain < 0)
00348                                 remain = 0;
00349 
00350                         va_start(ap, format2);
00351                         needed += vsnprintf(string_buf + needed, remain,
00352                                             format2, ap);
00353                         va_end(ap);
00354                 }
00355 
00356                 if (needed < max_nob) /* well. printing ok.. */
00357                         break;
00358         }
00359 
00360         if (*(string_buf+needed-1) != '\n')
00361                 printk(KERN_INFO "format at %s:%d:%s doesn't end in "
00362                        "newline\n", file, msgdata->msg_line, msgdata->msg_fn);
00363 
00364         header.ph_len = known_size + needed;
00365         debug_buf = (char *)page_address(tage->page) + tage->used;
00366 
00367         if (libcfs_debug_binary) {
00368                 memcpy(debug_buf, &header, sizeof(header));
00369                 tage->used += sizeof(header);
00370                 debug_buf += sizeof(header);
00371         }
00372 
00373         strcpy(debug_buf, file);
00374         tage->used += strlen(file) + 1;
00375         debug_buf += strlen(file) + 1;
00376 
00377         if (msgdata->msg_fn) {
00378                 strcpy(debug_buf, msgdata->msg_fn);
00379                 tage->used += strlen(msgdata->msg_fn) + 1;
00380                 debug_buf += strlen(msgdata->msg_fn) + 1;
00381         }
00382 
00383         __LASSERT(debug_buf == string_buf);
00384 
00385         tage->used += needed;
00386         __LASSERT(tage->used <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00387 
00388 console:
00389         if ((mask & libcfs_printk) == 0) {
00390                 /* no console output requested */
00391                 if (tcd != NULL)
00392                         cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00393                 return 1;
00394         }
00395 
00396         if (cdls != NULL) {
00397                 if (libcfs_console_ratelimit &&
00398                     cdls->cdls_next != 0 &&     /* not first time ever */
00399                     !cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(), cdls->cdls_next)) {
00400                         /* skipping a console message */
00401                         cdls->cdls_count++;
00402                         if (tcd != NULL)
00403                                 cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00404                         return 1;
00405                 }
00406 
00407                 if (cfs_time_after(cfs_time_current(), cdls->cdls_next +
00408                                                        libcfs_console_max_delay
00409                                                        + cfs_time_seconds(10))) {
00410                         /* last timeout was a long time ago */
00411                         cdls->cdls_delay /= libcfs_console_backoff * 4;
00412                 } else {
00413                         cdls->cdls_delay *= libcfs_console_backoff;
00414                 }
00415 
00416                 if (cdls->cdls_delay < libcfs_console_min_delay)
00417                         cdls->cdls_delay = libcfs_console_min_delay;
00418                 else if (cdls->cdls_delay > libcfs_console_max_delay)
00419                         cdls->cdls_delay = libcfs_console_max_delay;
00420 
00421                 /* ensure cdls_next is never zero after it's been seen */
00422                 cdls->cdls_next = (cfs_time_current() + cdls->cdls_delay) | 1;
00423         }
00424 
00425         if (tcd != NULL) {
00426                 cfs_print_to_console(&header, mask, string_buf, needed, file,
00427                                      msgdata->msg_fn);
00428                 cfs_trace_put_tcd(tcd);
00429         } else {
00430                 string_buf = cfs_trace_get_console_buffer();
00431 
00432                 needed = 0;
00433                 if (format1 != NULL) {
00434                         va_copy(ap, args);
00435                         needed = vsnprintf(string_buf,
00436                                            CFS_TRACE_CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE,
00437                                            format1, ap);
00438                         va_end(ap);
00439                 }
00440                 if (format2 != NULL) {
00441                         remain = CFS_TRACE_CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE - needed;
00442                         if (remain > 0) {
00443                                 va_start(ap, format2);
00444                                 needed += vsnprintf(string_buf+needed, remain,
00445                                                     format2, ap);
00446                                 va_end(ap);
00447                         }
00448                 }
00449                 cfs_print_to_console(&header, mask,
00450                                      string_buf, needed, file, msgdata->msg_fn);
00451 
00452                 put_cpu();
00453         }
00454 
00455         if (cdls != NULL && cdls->cdls_count != 0) {
00456                 string_buf = cfs_trace_get_console_buffer();
00457 
00458                 needed = snprintf(string_buf, CFS_TRACE_CONSOLE_BUFFER_SIZE,
00459                                   "Skipped %d previous similar message%s\n",
00460                                   cdls->cdls_count,
00461                                   (cdls->cdls_count > 1) ? "s" : "");
00462 
00463                 cfs_print_to_console(&header, mask,
00464                                      string_buf, needed, file, msgdata->msg_fn);
00465 
00466                 put_cpu();
00467                 cdls->cdls_count = 0;
00468         }
00469 
00470         return 0;
00471 }
00472 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_debug_vmsg2);
00473 
00474 void
00475 cfs_trace_assertion_failed(const char *str,
00476                            struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata)
00477 {
00478         struct ptldebug_header hdr;
00479 
00480         libcfs_panic_in_progress = 1;
00481         libcfs_catastrophe = 1;
00482         smp_mb();
00483 
00484         cfs_set_ptldebug_header(&hdr, msgdata, CDEBUG_STACK());
00485 
00486         cfs_print_to_console(&hdr, D_EMERG, str, strlen(str),
00487                              msgdata->msg_file, msgdata->msg_fn);
00488 
00489         panic("Lustre debug assertion failure\n");
00490 
00491         /* not reached */
00492 }
00493 
00494 static void
00495 panic_collect_pages(struct page_collection *pc)
00496 {
00497         /* Do the collect_pages job on a single CPU: assumes that all other
00498          * CPUs have been stopped during a panic.  If this isn't true for some
00499          * arch, this will have to be implemented separately in each arch.  */
00500         int                        i;
00501         int                        j;
00502         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00503 
00504         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pc->pc_pages);
00505 
00506         cfs_tcd_for_each(tcd, i, j) {
00507                 list_splice_init(&tcd->tcd_pages, &pc->pc_pages);
00508                 tcd->tcd_cur_pages = 0;
00509 
00510                 if (pc->pc_want_daemon_pages) {
00511                         list_splice_init(&tcd->tcd_daemon_pages,
00512                                                 &pc->pc_pages);
00513                         tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages = 0;
00514                 }
00515         }
00516 }
00517 
00518 static void collect_pages_on_all_cpus(struct page_collection *pc)
00519 {
00520         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00521         int i, cpu;
00522 
00523         for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
00524                 cfs_tcd_for_each_type_lock(tcd, i, cpu) {
00525                         list_splice_init(&tcd->tcd_pages, &pc->pc_pages);
00526                         tcd->tcd_cur_pages = 0;
00527                         if (pc->pc_want_daemon_pages) {
00528                                 list_splice_init(&tcd->tcd_daemon_pages,
00529                                                         &pc->pc_pages);
00530                                 tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages = 0;
00531                         }
00532                 }
00533         }
00534 }
00535 
00536 static void collect_pages(struct page_collection *pc)
00537 {
00538         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pc->pc_pages);
00539 
00540         if (libcfs_panic_in_progress)
00541                 panic_collect_pages(pc);
00542         else
00543                 collect_pages_on_all_cpus(pc);
00544 }
00545 
00546 static void put_pages_back_on_all_cpus(struct page_collection *pc)
00547 {
00548         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00549         struct list_head *cur_head;
00550         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00551         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00552         int i, cpu;
00553 
00554         for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
00555                 cfs_tcd_for_each_type_lock(tcd, i, cpu) {
00556                         cur_head = tcd->tcd_pages.next;
00557 
00558                         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc->pc_pages,
00559                                                  linkage) {
00560 
00561                                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00562 
00563                                 if (tage->cpu != cpu || tage->type != i)
00564                                         continue;
00565 
00566                                 cfs_tage_to_tail(tage, cur_head);
00567                                 tcd->tcd_cur_pages++;
00568                         }
00569                 }
00570         }
00571 }
00572 
00573 static void put_pages_back(struct page_collection *pc)
00574 {
00575         if (!libcfs_panic_in_progress)
00576                 put_pages_back_on_all_cpus(pc);
00577 }
00578 
00579 /* Add pages to a per-cpu debug daemon ringbuffer.  This buffer makes sure that
00580  * we have a good amount of data at all times for dumping during an LBUG, even
00581  * if we have been steadily writing (and otherwise discarding) pages via the
00582  * debug daemon. */
00583 static void put_pages_on_tcd_daemon_list(struct page_collection *pc,
00584                                          struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd)
00585 {
00586         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00587         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00588 
00589         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc->pc_pages, linkage) {
00590                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00591 
00592                 if (tage->cpu != tcd->tcd_cpu || tage->type != tcd->tcd_type)
00593                         continue;
00594 
00595                 cfs_tage_to_tail(tage, &tcd->tcd_daemon_pages);
00596                 tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages++;
00597 
00598                 if (tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages > tcd->tcd_max_pages) {
00599                         struct cfs_trace_page *victim;
00600 
00601                         __LASSERT(!list_empty(&tcd->tcd_daemon_pages));
00602                         victim = cfs_tage_from_list(tcd->tcd_daemon_pages.next);
00603 
00604                         __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(victim);
00605 
00606                         list_del(&victim->linkage);
00607                         cfs_tage_free(victim);
00608                         tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages--;
00609                 }
00610         }
00611 }
00612 
00613 static void put_pages_on_daemon_list(struct page_collection *pc)
00614 {
00615         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00616         int i, cpu;
00617 
00618         for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
00619                 cfs_tcd_for_each_type_lock(tcd, i, cpu)
00620                         put_pages_on_tcd_daemon_list(pc, tcd);
00621         }
00622 }
00623 
00624 void cfs_trace_debug_print(void)
00625 {
00626         struct page_collection pc;
00627         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00628         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00629 
00630         pc.pc_want_daemon_pages = 1;
00631         collect_pages(&pc);
00632         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc.pc_pages, linkage) {
00633                 char *p, *file, *fn;
00634                 struct page *page;
00635 
00636                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00637 
00638                 page = tage->page;
00639                 p = page_address(page);
00640                 while (p < ((char *)page_address(page) + tage->used)) {
00641                         struct ptldebug_header *hdr;
00642                         int len;
00643                         hdr = (void *)p;
00644                         p += sizeof(*hdr);
00645                         file = p;
00646                         p += strlen(file) + 1;
00647                         fn = p;
00648                         p += strlen(fn) + 1;
00649                         len = hdr->ph_len - (int)(p - (char *)hdr);
00650 
00651                         cfs_print_to_console(hdr, D_EMERG, p, len, file, fn);
00652 
00653                         p += len;
00654                 }
00655 
00656                 list_del(&tage->linkage);
00657                 cfs_tage_free(tage);
00658         }
00659 }
00660 
00661 int cfs_tracefile_dump_all_pages(char *filename)
00662 {
00663         struct page_collection  pc;
00664         struct file             *filp;
00665         struct cfs_trace_page   *tage;
00666         struct cfs_trace_page   *tmp;
00667         mm_segment_t            __oldfs;
00668         char                    *buf;
00669         int rc;
00670 
00671         cfs_tracefile_write_lock();
00672 
00673         filp = filp_open(filename, O_CREAT|O_EXCL|O_WRONLY|O_LARGEFILE, 0600);
00674         if (IS_ERR(filp)) {
00675                 rc = PTR_ERR(filp);
00676                 filp = NULL;
00677                 printk(KERN_ERR "LustreError: can't open %s for dump: rc %d\n",
00678                       filename, rc);
00679                 goto out;
00680         }
00681 
00682         pc.pc_want_daemon_pages = 1;
00683         collect_pages(&pc);
00684         if (list_empty(&pc.pc_pages)) {
00685                 rc = 0;
00686                 goto close;
00687         }
00688         __oldfs = get_fs();
00689         set_fs(get_ds());
00690 
00691         /* ok, for now, just write the pages.  in the future we'll be building
00692          * iobufs with the pages and calling generic_direct_IO */
00693         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc.pc_pages, linkage) {
00694 
00695                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00696 
00697                 buf = kmap(tage->page);
00698                 rc = vfs_write(filp, (__force const char __user *)buf,
00699                                tage->used, &filp->f_pos);
00700                 kunmap(tage->page);
00701                 if (rc != (int)tage->used) {
00702                         printk(KERN_WARNING "wanted to write %u but wrote "
00703                                "%d\n", tage->used, rc);
00704                         put_pages_back(&pc);
00705                         __LASSERT(list_empty(&pc.pc_pages));
00706                         break;
00707                 }
00708                 list_del(&tage->linkage);
00709                 cfs_tage_free(tage);
00710         }
00711         set_fs(__oldfs);
00712         rc = ll_vfs_fsync_range(filp, 0, LLONG_MAX, 1);
00713         if (rc)
00714                 printk(KERN_ERR "sync returns %d\n", rc);
00715 close:
00716         filp_close(filp, NULL);
00717 out:
00718         cfs_tracefile_write_unlock();
00719         return rc;
00720 }
00721 
00722 void cfs_trace_flush_pages(void)
00723 {
00724         struct page_collection pc;
00725         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00726         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00727 
00728         pc.pc_want_daemon_pages = 1;
00729         collect_pages(&pc);
00730         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc.pc_pages, linkage) {
00731 
00732                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00733 
00734                 list_del(&tage->linkage);
00735                 cfs_tage_free(tage);
00736         }
00737 }
00738 
00739 int cfs_trace_copyin_string(char *knl_buffer, int knl_buffer_nob,
00740                             const char __user *usr_buffer, int usr_buffer_nob)
00741 {
00742         int    nob;
00743 
00744         if (usr_buffer_nob > knl_buffer_nob)
00745                 return -EOVERFLOW;
00746 
00747         if (copy_from_user(knl_buffer, usr_buffer, usr_buffer_nob))
00748                 return -EFAULT;
00749 
00750         nob = strnlen(knl_buffer, usr_buffer_nob);
00751         while (nob-- >= 0)                      /* strip trailing whitespace */
00752                 if (!isspace(knl_buffer[nob]))
00753                         break;
00754 
00755         if (nob < 0)                            /* empty string */
00756                 return -EINVAL;
00757 
00758         if (nob == knl_buffer_nob)              /* no space to terminate */
00759                 return -EOVERFLOW;
00760 
00761         knl_buffer[nob + 1] = 0;                /* terminate */
00762         return 0;
00763 }
00764 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_trace_copyin_string);
00765 
00766 int cfs_trace_copyout_string(char __user *usr_buffer, int usr_buffer_nob,
00767                              const char *knl_buffer, char *append)
00768 {
00769         /* NB if 'append' != NULL, it's a single character to append to the
00770          * copied out string - usually "\n", for /proc entries and "" (i.e. a
00771          * terminating zero byte) for sysctl entries */
00772         int   nob = strlen(knl_buffer);
00773 
00774         if (nob > usr_buffer_nob)
00775                 nob = usr_buffer_nob;
00776 
00777         if (copy_to_user(usr_buffer, knl_buffer, nob))
00778                 return -EFAULT;
00779 
00780         if (append != NULL && nob < usr_buffer_nob) {
00781                 if (copy_to_user(usr_buffer + nob, append, 1))
00782                         return -EFAULT;
00783 
00784                 nob++;
00785         }
00786 
00787         return nob;
00788 }
00789 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_trace_copyout_string);
00790 
00791 int cfs_trace_allocate_string_buffer(char **str, int nob)
00792 {
00793         if (nob > 2 * PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)  /* string must be "sensible" */
00794                 return -EINVAL;
00795 
00796         *str = kmalloc(nob, GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_ZERO);
00797         if (*str == NULL)
00798                 return -ENOMEM;
00799 
00800         return 0;
00801 }
00802 
00803 int cfs_trace_dump_debug_buffer_usrstr(void __user *usr_str, int usr_str_nob)
00804 {
00805         char         *str;
00806         int           rc;
00807 
00808         rc = cfs_trace_allocate_string_buffer(&str, usr_str_nob + 1);
00809         if (rc != 0)
00810                 return rc;
00811 
00812         rc = cfs_trace_copyin_string(str, usr_str_nob + 1,
00813                                      usr_str, usr_str_nob);
00814         if (rc != 0)
00815                 goto out;
00816 
00817         if (str[0] != '/') {
00818                 rc = -EINVAL;
00819                 goto out;
00820         }
00821         rc = cfs_tracefile_dump_all_pages(str);
00822 out:
00823         kfree(str);
00824         return rc;
00825 }
00826 
00827 int cfs_trace_daemon_command(char *str)
00828 {
00829         int       rc = 0;
00830 
00831         cfs_tracefile_write_lock();
00832 
00833         if (strcmp(str, "stop") == 0) {
00834                 cfs_tracefile_write_unlock();
00835                 cfs_trace_stop_thread();
00836                 cfs_tracefile_write_lock();
00837                 memset(cfs_tracefile, 0, sizeof(cfs_tracefile));
00838 
00839         } else if (strncmp(str, "size=", 5) == 0) {
00840                 cfs_tracefile_size = simple_strtoul(str + 5, NULL, 0);
00841                 if (cfs_tracefile_size < 10 || cfs_tracefile_size > 20480)
00842                         cfs_tracefile_size = CFS_TRACEFILE_SIZE;
00843                 else
00844                         cfs_tracefile_size <<= 20;
00845 
00846         } else if (strlen(str) >= sizeof(cfs_tracefile)) {
00847                 rc = -ENAMETOOLONG;
00848         } else if (str[0] != '/') {
00849                 rc = -EINVAL;
00850         } else {
00851                 strcpy(cfs_tracefile, str);
00852 
00853                 printk(KERN_INFO
00854                        "Lustre: debug daemon will attempt to start writing "
00855                        "to %s (%lukB max)\n", cfs_tracefile,
00856                        (long)(cfs_tracefile_size >> 10));
00857 
00858                 cfs_trace_start_thread();
00859         }
00860 
00861         cfs_tracefile_write_unlock();
00862         return rc;
00863 }
00864 
00865 int cfs_trace_daemon_command_usrstr(void __user *usr_str, int usr_str_nob)
00866 {
00867         char *str;
00868         int   rc;
00869 
00870         rc = cfs_trace_allocate_string_buffer(&str, usr_str_nob + 1);
00871         if (rc != 0)
00872                 return rc;
00873 
00874         rc = cfs_trace_copyin_string(str, usr_str_nob + 1,
00875                                  usr_str, usr_str_nob);
00876         if (rc == 0)
00877                 rc = cfs_trace_daemon_command(str);
00878 
00879         kfree(str);
00880         return rc;
00881 }
00882 
00883 int cfs_trace_set_debug_mb(int mb)
00884 {
00885         int i;
00886         int j;
00887         int pages;
00888         int limit = cfs_trace_max_debug_mb();
00889         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00890 
00891         if (mb < num_possible_cpus()) {
00892                 printk(KERN_WARNING
00893                        "Lustre: %d MB is too small for debug buffer size, "
00894                        "setting it to %d MB.\n", mb, num_possible_cpus());
00895                 mb = num_possible_cpus();
00896         }
00897 
00898         if (mb > limit) {
00899                 printk(KERN_WARNING
00900                        "Lustre: %d MB is too large for debug buffer size, "
00901                        "setting it to %d MB.\n", mb, limit);
00902                 mb = limit;
00903         }
00904 
00905         mb /= num_possible_cpus();
00906         pages = mb << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00907 
00908         cfs_tracefile_write_lock();
00909 
00910         cfs_tcd_for_each(tcd, i, j)
00911                 tcd->tcd_max_pages = (pages * tcd->tcd_pages_factor) / 100;
00912 
00913         cfs_tracefile_write_unlock();
00914 
00915         return 0;
00916 }
00917 
00918 int cfs_trace_set_debug_mb_usrstr(void __user *usr_str, int usr_str_nob)
00919 {
00920         char     str[32];
00921         int      rc;
00922 
00923         rc = cfs_trace_copyin_string(str, sizeof(str), usr_str, usr_str_nob);
00924         if (rc < 0)
00925                 return rc;
00926 
00927         return cfs_trace_set_debug_mb(simple_strtoul(str, NULL, 0));
00928 }
00929 
00930 int cfs_trace_get_debug_mb(void)
00931 {
00932         int i;
00933         int j;
00934         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
00935         int total_pages = 0;
00936 
00937         cfs_tracefile_read_lock();
00938 
00939         cfs_tcd_for_each(tcd, i, j)
00940                 total_pages += tcd->tcd_max_pages;
00941 
00942         cfs_tracefile_read_unlock();
00943 
00944         return (total_pages >> (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)) + 1;
00945 }
00946 
00947 static int tracefiled(void *arg)
00948 {
00949         struct page_collection pc;
00950         struct tracefiled_ctl *tctl = arg;
00951         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
00952         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
00953         mm_segment_t __oldfs;
00954         struct file *filp;
00955         char *buf;
00956         int last_loop = 0;
00957         int rc;
00958 
00959         /* we're started late enough that we pick up init's fs context */
00960         /* this is so broken in uml?  what on earth is going on? */
00961 
00962         complete(&tctl->tctl_start);
00963 
00964         while (1) {
00965                 wait_queue_t __wait;
00966 
00967                 pc.pc_want_daemon_pages = 0;
00968                 collect_pages(&pc);
00969                 if (list_empty(&pc.pc_pages))
00970                         goto end_loop;
00971 
00972                 filp = NULL;
00973                 cfs_tracefile_read_lock();
00974                 if (cfs_tracefile[0] != 0) {
00975                         filp = filp_open(cfs_tracefile,
00976                                          O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_LARGEFILE,
00977                                          0600);
00978                         if (IS_ERR(filp)) {
00979                                 rc = PTR_ERR(filp);
00980                                 filp = NULL;
00981                                 printk(KERN_WARNING "couldn't open %s: "
00982                                        "%d\n", cfs_tracefile, rc);
00983                         }
00984                 }
00985                 cfs_tracefile_read_unlock();
00986                 if (filp == NULL) {
00987                         put_pages_on_daemon_list(&pc);
00988                         __LASSERT(list_empty(&pc.pc_pages));
00989                         goto end_loop;
00990                 }
00991                 __oldfs = get_fs();
00992                 set_fs(get_ds());
00993 
00994                 list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc.pc_pages, linkage) {
00995                         struct dentry *de = filp->f_path.dentry;
00996                         static loff_t f_pos;
00997 
00998                         __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
00999 
01000                         if (f_pos >= (off_t)cfs_tracefile_size)
01001                                 f_pos = 0;
01002                         else if (f_pos > i_size_read(de->d_inode))
01003                                 f_pos = i_size_read(de->d_inode);
01004 
01005                         buf = kmap(tage->page);
01006                         rc = vfs_write(filp, (__force const char __user *)buf,
01007                                        tage->used, &f_pos);
01008                         kunmap(tage->page);
01009                         if (rc != (int)tage->used) {
01010                                 printk(KERN_WARNING "wanted to write %u "
01011                                        "but wrote %d\n", tage->used, rc);
01012                                 put_pages_back(&pc);
01013                                 __LASSERT(list_empty(&pc.pc_pages));
01014                                 break;
01015                         }
01016                 }
01017                 set_fs(__oldfs);
01018 
01019                 filp_close(filp, NULL);
01020                 put_pages_on_daemon_list(&pc);
01021                 if (!list_empty(&pc.pc_pages)) {
01022                         int i;
01023 
01024                         printk(KERN_ALERT "Lustre: trace pages aren't "
01025                                " empty\n");
01026                         printk(KERN_ERR "total cpus(%d): ",
01027                                num_possible_cpus());
01028                         for (i = 0; i < num_possible_cpus(); i++)
01029                                 if (cpu_online(i))
01030                                         printk(KERN_ERR "%d(on) ", i);
01031                                 else
01032                                         printk(KERN_ERR "%d(off) ", i);
01033                         printk(KERN_ERR "\n");
01034 
01035                         i = 0;
01036                         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &pc.pc_pages,
01037                                                      linkage)
01038                                 printk(KERN_ERR "page %d belongs to cpu "
01039                                        "%d\n", ++i, tage->cpu);
01040                         printk(KERN_ERR "There are %d pages unwritten\n",
01041                                i);
01042                 }
01043                 __LASSERT(list_empty(&pc.pc_pages));
01044 end_loop:
01045                 if (atomic_read(&tctl->tctl_shutdown)) {
01046                         if (last_loop == 0) {
01047                                 last_loop = 1;
01048                                 continue;
01049                         } else {
01050                                 break;
01051                         }
01052                 }
01053                 init_waitqueue_entry(&__wait, current);
01054                 add_wait_queue(&tctl->tctl_waitq, &__wait);
01055                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
01056                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
01057                 remove_wait_queue(&tctl->tctl_waitq, &__wait);
01058         }
01059         complete(&tctl->tctl_stop);
01060         return 0;
01061 }
01062 
01063 int cfs_trace_start_thread(void)
01064 {
01065         struct tracefiled_ctl *tctl = &trace_tctl;
01066         int rc = 0;
01067 
01068         mutex_lock(&cfs_trace_thread_mutex);
01069         if (thread_running)
01070                 goto out;
01071 
01072         init_completion(&tctl->tctl_start);
01073         init_completion(&tctl->tctl_stop);
01074         init_waitqueue_head(&tctl->tctl_waitq);
01075         atomic_set(&tctl->tctl_shutdown, 0);
01076 
01077         if (IS_ERR(kthread_run(tracefiled, tctl, "ktracefiled"))) {
01078                 rc = -ECHILD;
01079                 goto out;
01080         }
01081 
01082         wait_for_completion(&tctl->tctl_start);
01083         thread_running = 1;
01084 out:
01085         mutex_unlock(&cfs_trace_thread_mutex);
01086         return rc;
01087 }
01088 
01089 void cfs_trace_stop_thread(void)
01090 {
01091         struct tracefiled_ctl *tctl = &trace_tctl;
01092 
01093         mutex_lock(&cfs_trace_thread_mutex);
01094         if (thread_running) {
01095                 printk(KERN_INFO
01096                        "Lustre: shutting down debug daemon thread...\n");
01097                 atomic_set(&tctl->tctl_shutdown, 1);
01098                 wait_for_completion(&tctl->tctl_stop);
01099                 thread_running = 0;
01100         }
01101         mutex_unlock(&cfs_trace_thread_mutex);
01102 }
01103 
01104 int cfs_tracefile_init(int max_pages)
01105 {
01106         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
01107         int     i;
01108         int     j;
01109         int     rc;
01110         int     factor;
01111 
01112         rc = cfs_tracefile_init_arch();
01113         if (rc != 0)
01114                 return rc;
01115 
01116         cfs_tcd_for_each(tcd, i, j) {
01117                 /* tcd_pages_factor is initialized int tracefile_init_arch. */
01118                 factor = tcd->tcd_pages_factor;
01119                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tcd->tcd_pages);
01120                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tcd->tcd_stock_pages);
01121                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tcd->tcd_daemon_pages);
01122                 tcd->tcd_cur_pages = 0;
01123                 tcd->tcd_cur_stock_pages = 0;
01124                 tcd->tcd_cur_daemon_pages = 0;
01125                 tcd->tcd_max_pages = (max_pages * factor) / 100;
01126                 LASSERT(tcd->tcd_max_pages > 0);
01127                 tcd->tcd_shutting_down = 0;
01128         }
01129         return 0;
01130 }
01131 
01132 static void trace_cleanup_on_all_cpus(void)
01133 {
01134         struct cfs_trace_cpu_data *tcd;
01135         struct cfs_trace_page *tage;
01136         struct cfs_trace_page *tmp;
01137         int i, cpu;
01138 
01139         for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
01140                 cfs_tcd_for_each_type_lock(tcd, i, cpu) {
01141                         tcd->tcd_shutting_down = 1;
01142 
01143                         list_for_each_entry_safe(tage, tmp, &tcd->tcd_pages, linkage) {
01144                                 __LASSERT_TAGE_INVARIANT(tage);
01145 
01146                                 list_del(&tage->linkage);
01147                                 cfs_tage_free(tage);
01148                         }
01149                         tcd->tcd_cur_pages = 0;
01150                 }
01151         }
01152 }
01153 
01154 static void cfs_trace_cleanup(void)
01155 {
01156         struct page_collection pc;
01157 
01158         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pc.pc_pages);
01159 
01160         trace_cleanup_on_all_cpus();
01161 
01162         cfs_tracefile_fini_arch();
01163 }
01164 
01165 void cfs_tracefile_exit(void)
01166 {
01167         cfs_trace_stop_thread();
01168         cfs_trace_cleanup();
01169 }
